DISTRIBUTED_STORAGE_DEFAULT_LOCATIONS.description: The list of storage engine(s) (by ID in DISTRIBUTED_STORAGE_CONFIG) whose images should be fully replicated, by default, to all other storage engines.

FEATURE_BLACKLISTED_EMAILS.description: If set to true, no new User accounts may be created if their email domain is blacklisted.

FEATURE_REQUIRE_ENCRYPTED_BASIC_AUTH.description: Whether non-encrypted passwords (as opposed to encrypted tokens) can be used for basic auth. Defaults to False

ENABLE_HEALTH_DEBUG_SECRET.description: If specified, a secret that can be given to health endpoints to see full debug info whennot authenticated as a superuser

FEATURE_STORAGE_REPLICATION.description: Whether to automatically replicate between storage engines. Defaults to False

FEATURE_REQUIRE_TEAM_INVITE.description: Whether to require invitations when adding a user to a team. Defaults to True

USERFILES_LOCATION.description: ID of the storage engine in which to place user-uploaded files

DISTRIBUTED_STORAGE_PREFERENCE.description: The preferred storage engine(s) (by ID in DISTRIBUTED_STORAGE_CONFIG) to use. A preferred engine means it is first checked for pullig and images are pushed to it.

FEATURE_LIBRARY_SUPPORT.description: Whether to allow for "namespace-less" repositories when pulling and pushing from Docker. Defaults to True

FEATURE_SUPER_USERS.description: Whether super users are supported. Defaults to True

FEATURE_GARBAGE_COLLECTION.description: Whether garbage collection of repositories is enabled. Defaults to True

FEATURE_PUBLIC_CATALOG.description: If set to true, the _catalog endpoint returns public repositories. Otherwise, only private repositories can be returned. Defaults to False

RECAPTCHA_SECRET_KEY.description: If recaptcha is enabled, the secret key for the Recaptcha service

FEATURE_ACI_CONVERSION.description: Whether to enable conversion to ACIs. Defaults to False

FEATURE_SECURITY_NOTIFICATIONS.description: If the security scanner is enabled, whether to turn of/off security notificaitons. Defaults to False

EXPIRED_APP_SPECIFIC_TOKEN_GC.description: Duration of time expired external app tokens will remain before being garbage collected. Defaults to 1d.

BLACKLISTED_EMAIL_DOMAINS.description: The array of email-address domains that is used if FEATURE_BLACKLISTED_EMAILS is set to true.

FEATURE_APP_REGISTRY.description: Whether to enable support for App repositories. Defaults to False

V2_PAGINATION_SIZE.description: The number of results returned per page in V2 registry APIs

PROMETHEUS_NAMESPACE.description: The prefix applied to all exposed Prometheus metrics. Defaults to `quay`

SUCCESSIVE_TRIGGER_FAILURE_DISABLE_THRES.description: If not None, the number of successive failures that can occur before a build trigger is automatically disabled. Defaults to 100.

FEATURE_READER_BUILD_LOGS.description: If set to true, build logs may be read by those with read access to the repo, rather than only write access or admin access. Defaults to False

SSL_PROTOCOLS.description: If specified, the nginx-defined list of SSL protocols to enabled and disabled

WEBHOOK_HOSTNAME_BLACKLIST.description: The set of hostnames to disallow from webhooks when validating, beyond localhost

APP_SPECIFIC_TOKEN_EXPIRATION.description: The expiration for external app tokens. Defaults to None.

BROWSER_API_CALLS_XHR_ONLY.description: If enabled, only API calls marked as being made by an XHR will be allowed from browsers. Defaults to True.

SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE.description: Whether the `secure` property should be set on session cookies. Defaults to False. Recommended to be True for all installations using SSL.

FEATURE_RECAPTCHA.description: Whether Recaptcha is necessary for user login and recovery. Defaults to False

FEATURE_AGGREGATED_LOG_COUNT_RETRIEVAL.description: Whether to allow retrieval of aggregated log counts. Defaults to True

SUCCESSIVE_TRIGGER_INTERNAL_ERROR_DISABL.description: If not None, the number of successive internal errors that can occur before a build trigger is automatically disabled. Defaults to 5.

MAIL_PASSWORD.description: The SMTP password to use when sending e-mails.

MAIL_PORT.description: The SMTP port to use. If not specified, defaults to 587.

FEATURE_LOG_EXPORT.description: Whether to allow exporting of action logs. Defaults to True

ACTION_LOG_ROTATION_THRESHOLD.description: If action log archiving is enabled, the time interval after which to archive data.

FEATURE_PERMANENT_SESSIONS.description: Whether sessions are permanent. Defaults to True

MAIL_DEFAULT_SENDER.description: If specified, the e-mail address used as the `from` when Quay sends e-mails. If none, defaults to `support@quay.io`.

TAG_EXPIRATION_OPTIONS.description: The options that users can select for expiration of tags in their namespace (if enabled)

MAXIMUM_LAYER_SIZE.description: Maximum allowed size of an image layer. Defaults to 20G

SUPER_USERS.description: Quay usernames of those users to be granted superuser privileges

MAIL_USERNAME.description: The SMTP username to use when sending e-mails.

FEATURE_ADVERTISE_V2.description: Whether the v2/ endpoint is visible. Defaults to True

USERFILES_PATH.description: Path under storage in which to place user-uploaded files

BLACKLIST_V2_SPEC.description: The Docker CLI versions to which Quay will respond that V2 is *unsupported*. Defaults to `<1.6.0`

RECAPTCHA_SITE_KEY.description: If recaptcha is enabled, the site key for the Recaptcha service

FEATURE_RESTRICTED_V1_PUSH.description: If set to true, only namespaces listed in V1_PUSH_WHITELIST support V1 push. Defaults to True

ALLOW_PULLS_WITHOUT_STRICT_LOGGING.description: If true, pulls in which the pull audit log entry cannot be written will still succeed. Useful if the database can fallback into a read-only state and it is desired for pulls to continue during that time. Defaults to False.

MAIL_USE_TLS.description: If specified, whether to use TLS for sending e-mails.

LOG_ARCHIVE_PATH.description: If builds are enabled, the path in storage in which to place the archived build logs.

V1_PUSH_WHITELIST.description: The array of namespace names that support V1 push if FEATURE_RESTRICTED_V1_PUSH is set to true.

DEFAULT_NAMESPACE_MAXIMUM_BUILD_COUNT.description: If not None, the default maximum number of builds that can be queued in a namespace.

FEATURE_CHANGE_TAG_EXPIRATION.description: Whether users and organizations are allowed to change the tag expiration for tags in their namespace. Defaults to True.

MAIL_SERVER.description: The SMTP server to use for sending e-mails. Only required if FEATURE_MAILING is set to true.

LOG_ARCHIVE_LOCATION.description: If builds are enabled, the storage engine in which to place the archived build logs.

DIRECT_OAUTH_CLIENTID_WHITELIST.description: A list of client IDs of *Quay-managed* applications that are allowed to perform direct OAuth approval without user approval.

SSL_CIPHERS.description: If specified, the nginx-defined list of SSL ciphers to enabled and disabled

DEFAULT_TAG_EXPIRATION.description: The default, configurable tag expiration time for time machine. Defaults to `2w`.

FEATURE_RATE_LIMITS.description: Whether to enable rate limits on API and registry endpoints. Defaults to False

PUBLIC_NAMESPACES.description: If a namespace is defined in the public namespace list, then it will appear on *all* user's repository list pages, regardless of whether that user is a member of the namespace. Typically, this is used by an enterprise customer in configuring a set of "well-known" namespaces.

FEATURE_READONLY_APP_REGISTRY.description: Whether to App repositories are read-only. Defaults to False
